metadata.Title: CVE-2018-2810 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.21 and prior. Easilyexploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause ahang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-2810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
